title: No, You Don’t Have ADHD, and Here Are 5 Reasons Why.
title_zh: 不，你没有多动症（ADHD）：这就是 5 个理由
summary_en: Clinical psychologist Elizabeth M. Ellis argues many adults online mislabel themselves as having ADHD. She presents five points: ADHD is a childhood-onset neurodevelopmental disorder; diagnostic symptoms must be evident before age 12; diagnosis requires functional impairment across settings; life-course outcomes typically include persistent difficulties into adulthood; and feeling better on stimulants is nonspecific and not diagnostic.
summary_zh: 临床心理学家 Elizabeth M. Ellis 指出，许多网友把自己误认为有 ADHD。她给出五点：ADHD 属于神经发育障碍，起病于童年；症状必须在 12 岁前可见；诊断需在多个情境下存在功能受损；典型个体在成年期仍有持续困难；对兴奋剂反应变好并不具有诊断意义。
best_quote_en: ADHD is a neurodevelopmental disorder. You do not ‘get’ ADHD past the age of 12.
best_quote_zh: ADHD 是一种神经发育障碍；在人超过 12 岁后不会“得上” ADHD。
